snippet: Hurricane Sandy sent nearly four feet of water cascading over Hudson River Park in TriBeCa, ruining electrical circuitry and causing more than $10 million in damage.
abstract: Hurricane Sandy sent nearly four feet of water cascading over Hudson River Park in TriBeCa, ruining electrical circuitry and causing more than $10 million in damage; park, which was struggling financially before the storm, remains unopened.
lead_paragraph: Hurricane Sandy sent nearly four feet of water cascading over Hudson River Park in TriBeCa, ruining electrical circuitry and causing more than $10 million in damage.

headline.seo: Hudson River Park Still Without Power Because of Hurricane Sandy
headline.main: Hudson River Park Still Without Power Weeks After Storm Damaged Equipment
headline.print_headline: Hudson River Park Still Without Power Weeks After Storm Damaged Equipment
